Job Title: Lead Embedded Test Automation Engineer - Cybersecurity
Skills Required: API Testing, DevOps, QA Automation, Quality Assurance, Security Testing, Software Testing, Test Automation, Test Management, Test Scenarios, Test Suites
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
                  In Harman Automotive we are bringing the software automotive industry into next level!
We do this by working with best car manufactures in the world, on functionalities and features that will be on the market in near future, with engaging methodologies and tools.
All above is done in Lodz along with other Harman locations. With our team of 300 employees, we want to integrate people who appreciate quality, creativity and teamwork.
Together we create passionate technology on exciting topics like: infotainment systems, telematics, ADAS
All of this is done by people as You.
Consider, if you want to be a part
of the future now.
Lead Embedded Test Automation Engineer - Cybersecurity
What You Will Do
Lead a team of QA engineersDefine QA processes and metrics for projectsDevelop automation frameworks for testing cybersecurity products. Setup cybersecurity products on top of existing automotive components. Testing cyber security products for integrity and functionality. Research and explore new environments – such as new automotive architectures, and cyber security approaches. Implement and monitor QA processes and performance metrics using different toolsSetup CI/CD tools
What You Need
At least 5 years of experience in embedded test automation developmentAt least 4 years of experience working with automated testing environments and Devops toolsAt least 6 years of experience of writing and managing test suites/cases/documentationAt least 8 years of experience of executing test suites and reporting test resultsB.Sc in Computer Science / Computer Engineering or in related topicsAbility to work independently in parallel to collaboration with other technical teams, peers and customers, both remotely and on-siteAdvanced analytical skills in analyzing logs and finding error causesAbility to debug and detect application errorsExperience with scripting tools. A quick learner, ready to work in a fast paced, multidisciplinary environment and toolsExperience in test scenarios execution and reportingCI/CD systems configuration
What Is Nice To Have
Experience in embedded systems / network systems / or similarExperience in software security testing or “White Hat Hacking”Experience in the automotive industryExperience with penetration testing
What We Offer:Work in international project team with the biggest worldwide automotive customersTraining on the job and technical trainingsFurther development opportunityA great package of additional benefits such as:flexible working time, full home office during Covid-19private healthcare (LuxMed),Mybenefit cafeteria,employee discounts on HARMAN products (JBL),game room,additional 1 day off in 2021 (24th December)and much more…

Skills Required: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD), English, Identity & Access Management (IAM), Linux, Microsoft SQL Server, Network Security, PKI, SQL, Shell Scripting, Unix
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
Project DescriptionCyber and Information Security is a global organization within Technology Services. Our services focus on access management for applications and infrastructure, identity management for users, directories, detecting/preventing measures for cyber threats, and exchanging/storing data securely. We provide consolidated and reliable security services that implement secure design principles, and create best-fit solutions.You'll be working in the Desktop Authentication, one of the product lines in the Identity and Access Management organization. We provide Multi-factor credentials for users to access network, Desktop solutions. You will be working for various projects that focuses on designing, integrating and engineering secure and robust solutions in the area of virtual smartcard credentials for internal usersOur team is global, diverse and collaborative as we work across organizations to keep our technology, applications and the businesses they support secure.Responsibilities Would you like to pursue your career in the security department in the role of System Engineer, building and supporting Desktop Authentication systems and applications ?Are you looking for an opportunity to work in a highly specialized and professional environment?We are looking for a motivated system engineer who:
• designs and implements applications in the wide area of Multifactor Authentication, OTP, PKI, certificate revocation list.• works with both technical and business stakeholders across the company, i.e. security architects, project leads, business analysts, testers and IT operations• transfers requirements into technical solutions that are integrated into a heterogeneous and highly automated infrastructure• performs problem analysis and is part of the supporting team when providing 3rd level supportMust have You have:
• A solid understanding of information security, specifically in OTP authentication, Radius, TOTP.• Sound knowledge in administering all aspects of PKI, Certificate Revocation List, OCSP• Experience with engineering solutions on Unix environments, scripting skills (e.g. Unix Shell scripting) and continuous integration and delivery ( CI / CD)• Basic knowledge of database solutions like MS SQL• Understanding of monitoring best practices (performance, health, capacity, etc.) and ability to translate these into working solutions that can be integrated into existing monitoring platforms• Fluency in multiple security domains (must: Identity and Access Management, Security Architecture and Engineering; desirable: Software Development Security, Security Operations, Security Assessment and Testing, Communication and Network Security)You are:• Experienced in IT security that goes beyond academic theorems, but rather than that, translates to practical implementations, that are robust but user friendly at the same time• Self-motivated, creative person, who takes end-to-end responsibility for appointed tasks and can drive own deliveries• A proven team player able to work in a collaborative way across organizations, teams and projects• Committed to excellence and quality, thriving for finding the best and simplest solutions• Capable of creating high quality systems documentation• Fluent in EnglishLanguagesEnglish: C1 Advanced

Skills Required: Communication, English, Linux, Microcontrollers, Oral Communication, Software Design, Software Development, Test Automation, Test Cases, Yocto Project
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
Description:Are you passionate about investigating complex engineering systems and challenging yourself?How would you like to be a part of the team that creates a transformative solution in the medical mechatronics area?We develop an automation testing framework for the leading manufacturer of the minimally invasive therapy equipment. You will be a key technical contributor and apply your hard and soft skills to discuss, prototype and develop the validation and verification solution for the next-generation surgical system.Join us and drive the innovation that changes lives!Requirements:  Strong С++ programming skills Good skills in Yocto/Linux Deep experience in software design including validation Understanding of the embedded microcontrollers organization Experience in CI and development of Test Automation Frameworks is a plus Prior experience in medical software development projects is a plus Strong written and oral communication skills (English) Ability to lead the team of developers and testers in case of demand
Job Responsibilities:  Develop a highly reliable solution for complex test cases automation Verify that the development process follows to the formal standards adopted in healthcare domain Effectively communicate with client, developers and testers
What We OfferExciting Projects: With clients across all industries and sectors, we offer an opportunity to work on market-defining products using the latest technologies.Collaborative Environment: You can expand your skills by collaborating with a diverse team of highly talented people in an open, laidback environment — or even abroad in one of our global centers or client facilities!Work-Life Balance: GlobalLogic prioritizes work-life balance, which is why we offer flexible work schedules.Professional Development: We develop paths suited to your individual talents through international knowledge exchanges and professional certification opportunities.Excellent Benefits: We provide our employees with private medical care, sports facilities cards, group life insurance, travel insurance, relocation package, food subsidies and cultural activities.Fun Perks: We want you to feel comfortable in your work, which is why we create good working environment with relax zones, host social and teambuilding activities and stock our kitchen with delicious teas and coffees!About GlobalLogic GlobalLogic is a leader in digital engineering. We help brands across the globe design and build innovative products, platforms, and digital experiences for the modern world. By integrating experience design, complex engineering, and data expertise—we help our clients imagine what’s possible, and accelerate their transition into tomorrow’s digital businesses. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, GlobalLogic operates design studios and engineering centers around the world, extending our deep expertise to customers in the automotive, communications, financial services, healthcare and life sciences, manufacturing, media and entertainment, semiconductor, and technology industries. GlobalLogic is a Hitachi Group Company operating under Hitachi, Ltd. (TSE: 6501) which contributes to a sustainable society with a higher quality of life by driving innovation through data and technology as the Social Innovation Business.

Skills Required: Android, Coroutines, Design Patterns, Kotlin, Model-View-Presenter (MVP), Model-view-viewmodel (MVVM), Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), Programming, RxJava, Unit Testing

About the job
        

 
At intive we innovate through design and engineering to create people-centric digital products. We are more than 3000 people with a passion for digital, who partner with the world’s leading brands such as Dow Jones, FOX, Warner Bros., Verizon, Macmillan, Facebook, Google, BMW, BlackBerry, Discovery, and more. 

Our clients come to us to solve their biggest and the most complex business and technology challenges. We have over 20 years of experience working with companies across many industries, including Media & Entertainment, EdTech, Telecommunications, Retail, Automotive, FinTech, and Transportation. 

You Are a Good Match If You
Have deep knowledge of Java/Kotlin and Android architectureHave strong knowledge of OOA, OOP as well as understanding of functional and reactive (Coroutines, RxJava) programming paraigmsHave experience in developing clean, maintainable, well-tested code (SOLID, Clean Architecture, Unit Tests)Have good knowledge of design patterns (MVVM/MVP)Fluency in verbal and written EnglishHave passion for software development 

You Get Extra Points For
Your own application in Google PlayKnowledge of different mobile architectures and native or hybrid platforms (ReactNative, Flutter, PWA)Domain knowledge and experience in e-commerce and/or VoDTeam or tech leadership experience

You Will Be Responsible For
Implementing new and improving existing applications of different complexity levelsWriting high quality, clean, stable and tested codeCreating full-size application architecture according to modern standardsPrototyping apps like MVPs and supporting pre-sales process advising and estimating solutionsWorking solo or in a team to release our customer's products on timeSharing knowledge inside/outside the companyActively collaborating within cross-functional teams during plannings, execution and revisions

Our Offer
You can choose how to work (tools, methods)Comfortable employment model (you choose type of agreement)Work-life balance - flexible hours and home officeYou will be working with an experienced team where relationships are built on a strong, informal culture.Your health taken care of (Medicover & Mulitisport)Life insurance (Nationale Nederlanden)Learning from other expertsNo stiff structure

Job Description:
About the job
        

 
At Nethone we create a team of friendly, flexible and open-minded technology enthusiastsOur mission is to make purchasing online safer and simpler. To achieve that we leverage deep user profiling and cutting-edge machine learning models.Our clients include Farfetch, Grover, Azul, Polish Airlines LOT, Booksy, Ramp Network and ING.Working with high profile companies across multiple sectors and geographies, Nethone enables clients to run their businesses safely and efficiently, increasing their revenues and their end-clients' satisfaction. We continually monitor cybercrime trends and techniques to stay ahead of fraudsters and provide our clients with the best possible anti-fraud solutions.Are you willing to join our ambitious team of self-starters with the drive to get quality things done?Join us and let's build Nethone together!14.000 - 20.000 PLN gross/month [permanent]14.000 - 20.000 PLN net/month [b2b]Product End in NethoneAs a company we specialize in fraud prevention. We enable online merchants to sell more, earn more, and maximize every dollar they invest in risk management and customer acquisition. With us, you will experience a great variance of datasets - we protect Clients in areas of e-commerce, crypto, ridesharing, digital lending, BNPL and many more.Now we are looking for a Python Developer with strong back-end development experience to join the Product End Team that is responsible for our client-facing services.In our team everybody takes responsibility for various pieces of code, functionally or project. This provides the opportunity to be the owner of a given domain and drive its direction as well as stay in focus with the task at hand.What's more? We work in Scrum using daily stand-ups, weekly sprints, starting from planning and finishing with review and retro.Our technology stack: Back End: Python 3, PostgreSQL (with SQLAlchemy), FastAPI, Pyramid, Pytest But also: Nginx, RabbitMQ, RedisFront End: Vanilla ES6+, React, MobX, D3Development process: Docker, Kubernetes, GitLab (repository, issue tracker, CI), Sentry, Grafana
What will you be responsible for? Working on the public and internal API backendsDesigning and implementing new features (code, tests, documentation) and maintaining current ones (optimizations, bug fixes)Conducting code reviewsTaking part in brainstorms, workshops and other team and cross-team meetings
What do we expect from you? At least 3 years of experience as Back-end DeveloperStrong knowledge of Python, familiarity with Python libraries: SQLAlchemy, PytestExperience in using Docker, Kubernetes (from the developer side)Good understanding of HTTP protocol as well as good knowledge of Relational Databases; SQL; some ORMFamiliarity with following topics: Internet protocols, Browser Cache, Authentication mechanisms, web-applications performance, Unix, Encoding, Encryption and other things related to web-applicationsFluency in the basic usage of Linux terminal and GitCommunicative English
Nice to have: Willingness to develop as a FullStack DeveloperWorking experience with large scale, data intensive applications
Our Benefits:Remote-first cultureand truly international team (+10 countries)Flexible working hoursMorning birds, night owls and people working from another continent feel equally comfortableSelf developmentCash awards for the quarter's best employees, funding for development materials and trainingsTeam buildingCompany-wide meetings in person, budgets of each team for its own integrations, cyclical office integrationsHealth and wellnessTaking care about employees' mental and physical health. Multisport and health insuranceEnglish classesEnglish is our main language of communication and our employees are able to improve their skills by attending free classesData processingPlease note that consents for data processing below can be withdrawn at any time, which will not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.Click here for more info.

Skills Required: C (Programming Language), C#, Communication, Computer Science, E2E, Exploratory Testing, Non-Functional Requirements, Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA), Tracking Systems, WSE
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
Why this role is important to us: In SimCorp, we support some of the biggest financial institutions in the world to be successful by simplifying their investments, accounting, and operations.You will be a member of a self-organized scrum team consisting of Software Engineers with close collaboration with business experts. The team is responsible for developing and supporting a set of e nterprise products within the Collateral Product Area . You expected to interact with colleagues from Ukraine, Poland, Denmark, Austria, G ermany and UK . After comprehensive onboarding program we expect you to :   Design, develop and test new f eatures as well as support the existing product .  Create test cases and automated tests to cover the features’ acceptance criteria (E2E, API, UT).  Closely c ommunica te and collaborate with Team, Product Owner , Technical Leads during feature analysis, refinement , development , implementation and test .  Analyze functional and non-functional requirements during feature refinements .  Support of the product.  Prepare and conduct Sprint review/DEMO sessions.  Initiate technical and process enhancements in the team.  Be proactive to improve automation, tools, frameworks, etc.  Work as a full stack developer, both f ront- e nd (desktop) and b ack- e nd ( SOA ).  Create and execute test cases to cover user stories .  Take a leading role in developing automated tests to cover the features’ acceptance criteria.  Analy ze the root cause of the errors’ inflow and create defects in the tracking system.  Define proactive actions to improve the quality of the product.  Preventively protect product confidence with exploratory testing and keep the high quality of the product under development by regression testing. Initiate technical and process enhancements in the team.  Be proactive to improve automation, tools, frameworks, etc. 
 Your qualifications:   A M.Sc. in Finance, Computer Science, Mathematics or a similar field  Profound knowledge and experience in C # or other object-oriented language  Curiosity and readiness to learn in-house tools and frameworks , including functional programming language AP L  Knowledge and experience in designing and implementation of all-level tests (E2E, API, UT)  Understanding and adherence to XP practices (TDD, BDD, pair-programming etc.)  Practical experience of development based on relational DB (SQL)  Understanding of CI/CD processes and tools (git, TeamCity, etc.)  Readiness to support existing system (legacy)  Good English skills (upper intermediate and higher), written as well as spoken, as English is our corporate language  A bility and willingness to apply broad knowledge in different areas and constantly learn new things, such as specific business domain knowledge or new technologies  Good communication and presentation skills  (Preferably) Knowledge and experience in financial domain, fintech  (Preferably) Experience as a member of Scrum team 
Benefits:Attractive salary, bonus scheme, and pension are essential for any work agreement. However, in SimCorp, we believe we can offer more. Therefore, in addition to the traditional benefit scheme, we provide a great work & life balance and opportunities for professional development: there is never just only one route - we offer an individual approach to professional development to support the direction you want to take.Next steps:Applying for a job at SimCorp can involve several stages. Whenever possible, we’ll try to shorten our standard process outlined below. However, depending on the specific requirements of the hiring team, an additional step or meeting may be required – we’ll keep you informed at every stage. Initial callwith Talent Acquisition PartnerMeeting with the Team Managerin-depth conversation about the role and your previous experienceTechnical meetingwith Team membersFeedback and final offer
Who we are:For over 50 years, we have worked closely with investment and asset managers to become the world’s leading provider of integrated investment management solutions. We are 2,100+ colleagues with a broad range of nationalities, educations, professional experiences, ages, and backgrounds in general.SimCorp is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a culture where diverse perspectives and expertise are integrated in our everyday work. We believe in the continual growth and development of our employees so that we can provide best-in-class solutions to our clients.While striving to deliver client value, we believe it is vital to consider our people and our planet in every business decision we make. Acting responsibly is not optional. It is essential.

Skills Required: Amazon Web Services (AWS), Cloud Infrastructure, Cloud Strategy, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD), Learning, Microservices, Pharmaceuticals, SQL, Site Reliability Engineering, Software Development
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
Location: Poland/Spain (hybrid/remote)

Role Summary

This is a staff engineer position within the Analytics Center of Excellence (ACOE) department of the Research & Development Solutions org (R&DSIT).

This SRE is responsible for the design and implementation of a hybrid cloud strategy including both public cloud (AWS) and on-premises deployments to support distributed software systems that serve an array of scenarios related to clinical trials and other lines of IQVIA’s pharma/tech business.

This is a highly collaborative role working in partnership with peer SREs, IT groups and software engineering teams to stand-up environments, deploy applications, establish metrics, and achieve infrastructure performance and stability targets. As a staff engineer you will be empowered to identify best ways to contribute your time and effort for maximum ROI/impact.

The ideal candidate is more than an infrastructure specialist but also an experienced software engineer and able to participate in design, development and leadership activities.

Responsibilities:
Consultation and collaboration with software development teamsActively participate in Agile practicesAssist with infosec assessmentsWork with cloud infrastructure providersConfigure deployment automation frameworksEstablish best practices for consistency among software development teamsContinuous improvement, take proactive steps to improve product quality and process efficiencyResearch current and emerging industry tools and techniques and share these findings with colleaguesConsistently deliver robust, high-quality, reliable engineering outcomes in cross functional autonomous scrum teams Drive curiosity and innovation Lead cross-team exercises, including DevOps incident management bridges Lead documentation efforts for product architecture and security compliance Lead security assessments and product readiness evaluation Mentor interns, apprentices, and other engineers
Qualifications:
8+ years of relevant collaborative software engineering experience Linux experience with the ability to configure environments through the use of software toolsExperience with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible, CI/CD, AWS, GitLabSolid understanding of microservices and restful servicesSolid understanding of relational database management systemsStrong verbal and written communications skillsDemonstrated in-depth understanding of product development lifecycle Experience deploying code into production through CI/CD tools (not just “CI/CD Pipeline”)
Let's Talk About You...
You're Customer-Focused. You have opinions about how users will use the product, and what problem they might run into. Being interested and willing to dive into and understand customers' problems is both helpful and rewarding.You’re Driven. You set challenging goals for yourself and push yourself to meet them; you have a passion for delivering high-quality quickly; and you enjoy working at a fast pace.You’re Collaborative. You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others so we all can become better. You treat your colleagues with honesty, kindness, and respect and actively do your part to create a positive work environment.You’re Humble. You are unafraid to ask questions when you don’t know the answer, and you approach disagreements with the possibility that you might be wrong
IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Job Description:
About the job
        

 
At BBH we value diverse backgrounds, so if your experience looks a little different from what we've outlined and you think you can bring value to the role, we will still welcome your application!Join us as a Systems Reliability Engineering a.k.a. Scalability-Reliability-Efficiency (SRE) Tech Lead.Brown Brothers Harriman is currently recruiting Systems Reliability Engineering a.k.a. Scalability-Reliability-Efficiency (SRE) Tech Lead to join our Digital Transformation Systems Team of 3 SRE engineers. We are looking for someone who is driven to get things done and views obstacles as an exciting challenge that demands a creative solution. Above all, we seek someone who takes great pride in their work and is inspired and motivated by their role in protecting and enhancing our client’s financial well-being. Resilience analysis – leveraging analysis of potential impact vectors and in-depth understanding of the application code, identify and simulate negative scenarios to highlight resilience hotspotsPerformance and scalability engineering – track efficiency trends using production statistics and results of automated tests and reconfigure applications to meet scalability demands and adjust resource guaranteesUpgrade coordination - monitor component end-of-life and version vulnerability and coordinate upgrades of the platform elementsCI/CD tuning – adjust and test environment configurations to ensure throughput, stability, High Availability and Business ContinuityArchitecture - participate in application architecture reviews with the goal of minimizing instability risks by evaluating requirements, simplifying architecture and ensuring defensive codingMonitoring - design and develop monitoring dashboards and measurement facilities along with KPI thresholds and acceptable outage/error levels in various categoriesIncident resolution – participate in incident mitigation efforts and their post-mortem analysis
 2 additional days added to your holiday calendar for Culture Celebration and Community ServicePrivate medical care for you and your familyLife InsuranceHybrid Working OpportunitiesProfessional trainings and qualification supportThrive Wellbeing ProgramOnline benefit platformContracts for an indefinite period of time with no probation period
 Technical team leadership traits with organizational and communication skillsProficiency in error and performance analysis and problem-solving attitudeUnderstanding of Microservice architecture in Linux environment and relevant monitoring toolsExperience in creating and tuning Java applications (Spring)Knowledge of Python and some of its Data Analysis packages such as numpy and pandasExperience with container technologies, Kubernetes or OpenShiftExperience with CD/CI (Git, Jenkins, Maven)RDBMS concepts – basic principles of query optimization, preferably in Oracle environmentB. S. Degree in Computer Science or related field experienceGood communication skills and working proficiency in English
 Experience with Python AI packages such as tensorflow, scikit-learn or kerasAdvanced Splunk skillsUnderstanding of performance testing tools such as JMeterBasic web optimization techniques
If you join BBH you will a find collaborative environment that enables you to step outside your role to add value wherever you can. You will have direct access to clients, information and experts across all business areas around the world. BBH will provide you with opportunities to grow your expertise, take on new challenges, and reinvent yourself—without leaving the firm. We encourage a culture of inclusion that values each employee’s unique perspective. We provide a high-quality benefits program emphasizing good health, financial security, and peace of mind. Ultimately we want you to have rewarding work with the flexibility to enjoy personal and family experiences at every career stage. Our BBH Cares program offers volunteer opportunities to give back to your community and help transform the lives of othersAt Brown Brothers Harriman, we believe no job is too big or small for any of us to handle if it helps our clients. We value passionate, committed people who enjoy collaborating with others to find new solutions to complex business challenges. We are looking for the type of person who speaks their mind, truly listens and steps outside their role to add value wherever they can. Someone who is driven to get things done and views obstacles as an exciting challenge that demands a creative solution. Above all, we seek someone who takes great pride in their work and is inspired and motivated by their role in protecting and enhancing our client’s financial well-being.If you are looking for an entrepreneurial environment where you can learn and thrive, Brown Brothers Harriman is the right place for you.Full timeKrakow

Skills Required: Back-End Web Development, Communication, Containerization, Databases, Front-End Development, Linux, Object-Relational Mapping (ORM), Scripting, Software Development, Technical Documentation
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
Why N-ableIT doesn’t get better than this! N-able isn’t just another software company – we’re going places, and we’d love for you to be a part of that journey. With N-ablites in more than 15 countries around the world, you’re adding your unique voice to a diverse team of people who are supporting our customers, and one another. The Way We Work, our hybrid working model based on trust and flexibility, allows you to maximize your contributions while growing your career. Join a team where you can make a difference!This is an amazing time to join the team as Cove is the fastest-growing product at N-Able and one of the 3 largest revenue-generating products. This is a Cloud-first data protection as a service product that keeps safe customer servers & workstations (files/network shares/databases/hypervisors) as well as SaaS data sources (M365) with over 170+ petabytes of protected data, 700K+ protected devices.What You'll Do  Review requirements, specifications and technical documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback Design and review architecture of complex features with multiple components and implement functional and non-functional requirement Independently develop complex features through multiple software layers Work on application performance improvements and tuning, support the code by writing automated tests Solve escalations & customer issues, provide root cause analysis and bug prevention Provide technical feedback and assistance on others' code and design, help to integrate others' code to a common solution, prepare technical documentation Communicate status to all the stakeholders. Discuss and escalate issues in a timely fashion
What You'll Bring  Expert knowledge and experience in С++ (5+ years) Strong knowledge of low-level operating system details (Windows, macOS, Linux) Understanding of the relational databases and SQL, object-relational mapping Experience with modern CI/CD approaches and tools Understanding of the Virtualization and Containerization concepts, hands-on experience with Docker/Kubernetes Experience with scripting languages (Python, Bash, PowerShell, JavaScript)
Purple Perks  Medical for employees, partner and dependents - fully covered for employees! Generous PTO and observed holidays 2 Paid VoluNteer Days per year Employee Stock Purchase Program PPK with company-contribution Company-wide 'No Meeting' Days FuN-raising opportunities as part of our giving program N-ablite Learning – custom learning experience as part of our investment in you The Way We Work – our hybrid working model based on trust and flexibility
About N-ableAt N-able, Inc. (NYSE: NABL), we are a global software company that turns IT possibilities into capabilities. That means we partner with technology leaders who support companies around the world by offering secure infrastructure and tools to navigate their evolving IT needs. We build strong relationships with our customers to help them thrive at every stage of growth, and at the heart of this effort is our network of N- ablites —a global team of extraordinary, diverse creators who are dedicated to making a difference in how our partners do IT.

About the job
        

 
The person in the given job position will be responsible for development of innovative technical functions and control algorithms for embedded systems in the HVAC area, covering the entire specification, analysis, design and test process. Your responsibilities:  You will be responsible for the analysis of product and system requirements characteristic for thermal and electrical energy systems You will be responsible for the specification, implementation and test of system functions, applied to thermal and electrical energy systems with focus on heat pumps and energy management systemsYou will be designing and validating the functions and algorithms on early stage of development using simulations methods to obtain best quality and performance and check the validate the results through laboratory tests with real devices You will support your team during the specification of test concepts and cases that are carried out on system, integration and unit level You will document developed functions and interfaces
We expect experience with: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, preferable in the field of electronics, automation & controls, mechatronics or system engineering3 to 5 years of experience in the field outlined by the tasks aboveExpertise in using tools related to model-based design, preferable Matlab/SimulinkPractical experience in design of control algorithms Experience in development of software for embedded systems Knowledge on the modeling procedure of dynamical systems focusing on thermal and/or electrical energy domainExperience in object-oriented programming is a plusVery good English skills, German is a plus

Skills Required: API Testing, Communication, Manual Testing, Mobile Testing, Quality Assurance, Software Quality, Software Quality Assurance, Software Testing, Test Cases, Test Planning
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
Job Requisition ID #23WD67222We are looking for undergraduates and graduates with passion for mechanical engineering or fluid dynamics, who want to gain experience as a Quality Assurance Engineer and for a few weeks become a part of software development team.The internship will start in July 2023 and is planned for ten weeks. During this time, we will make sure you are challenged and given every opportunity to grow your knowledge and experience with the support of experienced Autodesk employees.In the Krakow office we develop Generative Design for Fusion, a leading solution for quick generation of high-performing design alternatives, the so-called design exploration process. Designers or engineers input design goals into generative design software, with parameters such as performance, materials, manufacturing method or costs. The software explores all possible permutations of a solution and generates design alternatives.As part of Autodesk, you will work with one of our scrum teams, with several developers and quality assurance engineers. You will have an opportunity to work on the design project using our solutions, often not yet released to the customers. Proposed project is optimization of go-cart parts using Generative Design. While working on the project you will also have an occasion to complete quality assurance tasks, especially to provide feedback on the functionalities you used. This way you will help us develop better solutions for our customers. Ability to communicate with English speaking stakeholdersBasic knowledge of Mechanical EngineeringExperience with CAD software
At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers.Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on discretionary annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock or long-term incentive cash grants, and a comprehensive benefits package. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Job Description:
About the job
        

 
Department: EngineeringEmployment Type: Fixed Term ContractLocation: WarsawReporting To: Delyan TashevDescriptionAre you an incredible senior secops engineer, can work well in a team and want to be a game-changer in a fast-growing startup?WeTravel (www.wetravel.com) is an online payment platform that helps travel companies transition from paper-based and traditional finances, communication and marketing to digital excellence fit for today’s modern travel industry.We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds and underrepresented groups and would invite you to apply. We believe a diverse workforce is a highly productive one, so take a chance, send us your application even if you don't meet all our requirements, we may surprise you!This position presents the opportunity to work in a business-critical role in a rapidly growing company. You will also uphold our four core values: Be the solution - take ownership, drive collaborationBe resourceful - strive for new wins every dayBe honest - default to transparencyBe respectful - treat others like you want to be treated
LOCATION:If you are based in Amsterdam or Azerbaijan the position will be on-site/hybrid.If you are based in a location within 1-3 hours CET you will work remote.Role SummaryAs a security engineer you will be a part of a cross-functional and an agile team of 3-5 people, where you will; Identify threats to our reputation,Identify threats to operability,Identify threats to direct financial damage,Architect solutions to security issues,Resolve security issues,Push resolution of security issues,Be a DevOps that fixes security issues with the help of automation,Make, analyze and prioritize security assessments,Help us certify,Perform or recommend and integrate security solutions,Establish security policies, frameworks, processes, controls, metrics and etc.,All from the ROLE SUMMARY done with a DevOps approach/mindset,If you know Ruby you can also update the apps we write to stay secure,Collaborate with the application team leads to ensure that the security is met, monitored, added to statistics, analyzed, incidents are escalated for every component,Partner with DevOps and developers on securing our systems.
If you are interested to learn more about our tech stack, check out our stackshare.io profile!Preferred Experience An experienced senior SecOps engineer or a senior DevOps that understands Security well,Senior Linux Admin experience,Advanced knowledge of the following programming languages for DevOps; HashiCorp Configuration Language (Terraform) and Bash, for the platform developing Ruby or Python or Go,Experience with CI/CD, AWS EC2, Kubernetes, Docker,Clear understanding of the technologies supporting areas such as Cloud Computing (AWS), Micro Services, Streaming Technologies, Network etc,Ability to install and configure software, gather test-stage data, and perform debugging,Solid experience and mindset on Cloud based security solution and architecture design and implementation.
Nice to have Corresponding library/image update experiences on microservices based frontend and backend applications are preferred.
Benefits Attractive compensationUnlimited Paid Time Off!Amazing new offices in the heart of Amsterdam - rooftop gardenTuesday and Friday team lunchesAs a travel-related company, we have fantastic team retreats, two of our founders love surfing, so it's normally beside a great beachThe latest tech you need to be successful.For candidates resident outside the Netherlands salaries are depends on the location are weighted according to local factors and considerationsYou can be based in Amsterdam or within 1/2 hours CET in your country of residence.

About the job
        

 
At Nethone we create a team of friendly, flexible and open-minded technology enthusiastsOur mission is to make purchasing online safer and simpler. To achieve that we leverage deep user profiling and cutting-edge machine learning models.Our clients include Farfetch, Grover, Azul, Polish Airlines LOT, Booksy, Ramp Network and ING.Working with high profile companies across multiple sectors and geographies, Nethone enables clients to run their businesses safely and efficiently, increasing their revenues and their end-clients' satisfaction. We continually monitor cybercrime trends and techniques to stay ahead of fraudsters and provide our clients with the best possible anti-fraud solutions.Are you willing to join our ambitious team of self-starters with the drive to get quality things done?Join us and let's build Nethone together!18 000 - 24 000 PLN gross/month [permanent]18 000 - 24 000 PLN net/month [b2b]About The RoleAs a company we specialize in fraud prevention. We enable online merchants to sell more, earn more, and maximize every dollar they invest in risk management and customer acquisition. With us, you will experience a great variance of datasets - we protect Clients in areas of e-commerce, crypto, ridesharing, digital lending, BNPL and many more.Now we are looking for a Senior Python Developer with strong back-end development experience to join the Product End Team that is responsible for our client-facing services.In our team everybody takes responsibility for various pieces of code, functionally or project. This provides the opportunity to be the owner of a given domain and drive its direction as well as stay in focus with the task at hand.What's more? We work in Scrum using daily stand-ups, weekly sprints, starting from planning and finishing with review and retro.Our technology stack: Back End: Python 3, PostgreSQL (with SQLAlchemy), FastAPI, Pyramid, Pytest But also: Nginx, RabbitMQ, RedisFront End: Vanilla ES6+, React, MobX, D3Development process: Docker, Kubernetes, GitLab (repository, issue tracker, CI), Sentry, Grafana

Working on the public and internal API backendsDesigning and implementing new features (code, tests, documentation) and maintaining current ones (optimizations, bug fixes)Conducting code reviewsTaking part in brainstorms, workshops and other team and cross-team meetings
What do we expect from you? At least 4 years of experience as Back-end DeveloperStrong knowledge of Python, familiarity with Python libraries: SQLAlchemy, PytestExperience in using Docker, Kubernetes (from the developer side)Good understanding of HTTP protocol as well as good knowledge of Relational Databases; SQL; some ORMFamiliarity with following topics: Internet protocols, Browser Cache, Authentication mechanisms, web-applications performance, Unix, Encoding, Encryption and other things related to web-applicationsFluency in the basic usage of Linux terminal and GitExperience in maintenance of production services (deployment; monitoring). Willingness to share knowledge with less experienced developers. Communicative English
Nice to have: Willingness to develop as a FullStack DeveloperWorking experience with large scale, data intensive applicationsPresented ability to lead technical agenda of a project
Our Benefits:Remote-first cultureand truly international team (+10 countries)Flexible working hoursMorning birds, night owls and people working from another continent feel equally comfortableSelf developmentCash awards for the quarter's best employees, funding for development materials and trainingsTeam buildingCompany-wide meetings in person, budgets of each team for its own integrations, cyclical office integrationsHealth and wellnessTaking care about employees' mental and physical health. Multisport and health insuranceEnglish classesEnglish is our main language of communication and our employees are able to improve their skills by attending free classesData processingPlease note that consents for data processing below can be withdrawn at any time, which will not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.Click here for more info.

Job Title: Scala Software Engineer, API Platform (Remote - Poland)
Skills Required: Back-End Web Development, Functional Programming, GraphQL, High Performance Computing (HPC), Optimization Techniques, Performance Tuning, Programming, Responsiveness, Technical Discussions, Ticketing Systems
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
BigCommerce’s mission is to help merchants sell more at every stage of growth, from small startups, to mid-market businesses to large enterprises. We focus on being the best ecommerce platform so our customers can focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.We are equally passionate about growing our employee’s careers and providing them an incredible experience as we rapidly expand across the globe. We are proud to have been recognized numerous times for our product and workplace culture. We empower our people and customers to build, innovate and grow, so together we can redefine the ecommerce industry.Scala Software Engineer, API PlatformEngineeringBigCommerce is disrupting the e-commerce industry as the SaaS leader for fast-growing, mid-market businesses. We enable our customers to build intuitive and engaging stores at a fraction of the cost to support every stage of their growth.BigCommerce is looking for a Scala Software Engineer for API Platform team. This growing team is looking for an engineer with a strong technical background who will focus on improving the performance, reliability, and features of our API Platform. We use technologies like Scala, gRPC, service mesh, Docker to build one of the fastest and most reliable ecommerce platforms in the world.BigCommerce offers a dynamic, collaborative environment, helping you expand your skills and take ideas from inception to delivery. Build our flagship GraphQL APIUtilize performance optimization techniques to ensure the responsiveness of the platformBuild new features with a focus on testability, extensibility, and maintainabilityBuild highly-available, high-performance, redundant, and scalable distributed systemsWork closely with stakeholders to improve the architecture while building and scaling back-end servicesMaintain and improve our backend Scala servicesWrite code that is high-performance, maintainable, clear, and conciseEnsure the quality of code from development to productionCollaborate with the teams located across the Globe
 2+ years of professional experience as a Software Engineer1+ years of Scala in a production environment, performance monitoring and tuning is a plusKnowledge of object-oriented and functional programming techniquesKnowledge of highly scalable architecturesStrong desire to learn new languages, frameworks, best practices and design patternsWrite code that is performant, fault-tolerant, maintainable, testable and conciseParticipate in code reviews to ensure best practicesHelp to design and implement systems, participate in technical discussionsHave great attention to detailExperience monitoring and operating microservicesFamiliarity with agile methodologies and ticketing systems such as JIRA
 Work with modern technologies, cloud development and highly scalable distributed systemsWork for an international Product companyBe responsible for development of our flagship GraphQL API, be a part of our success.Become an expert in the area and provide high quality Product to the marketLearn from senior professionals and share knowledge, expertise and good practices to the teamPrivate Medical CareTraining and certification possibilitiesRestricted Stock UnitsBe a part of a fast-growing companyWork remotely from Poland
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at BigCommerceOur employees make the difference. At BigCommerce, we believe that celebrating the unique histories, perspectives and abilities of every employee makes a difference for our company, our customers and our community. We are an equal opportunity employer and the inclusive atmosphere we build together will make room for every person to contribute, grow and thrive.We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the interview process, to perform essential job functions and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you need an accommodation in order to interview at BigCommerce, please let us know during any of your interactions with our recruiting team.Learn more about the BigCommerce team, culture and benefits at https://careers.bigcommerce.com.

About the job
        

 
Job ID: 15670 We are looking for experienced Full Stack or Frontend Developer who understands and can deliver on complex IT and business challenges, and turn them into visionary customer-centric digital experiences. This is an opportunity for you to help shape and deliver the digital services of the future for our business and corporate customers.In Nordea, we’re harnessing the power of technology to reinvent the future of banking. A tech revolution is underway – and you can make an impact. Though we’re a Nordic bank, we’re also one of the largest IT employers in Tricity and Warsaw. Working with international teams in an inspiring working environment, you’ll have lots of opportunities to expand your skills and advance your career.About This OpportunityYou'll join one of our Digital Banking units with allocation to Digital Scalable Model – one of two agile development Hubs within or Digital Servicing Corporate portfolio (Business Banking), where we shape and deliver digital services with focus on the smaller and less complex business banking customers.We are concluding delivery of a new common Nordic business banking web platform serving business banking customers in Denmark, Finland, Sweden, and soon also Norway and have initiated delivering the digital banking services of the future.You will be part of a dedicated agile team and part of a digital Hub located mainly in Warsaw (currently with 6 agile teams in total). You will be part of the digital development journey from shaping the technical solutions to developing it and contributing to the continued running of the platform the includes both web and mobile.What you’ll be doing: Invent and improve services and processesChallenge solutions, requirements and processes to make the future betterInteract with other developers, teams and stakeholders to create the best possible solution
What we can offer you: Ownership of the code in your service area and ensure quality of the implementationBe a part of the fast-growing team of software development professionals. 
The role is based in Warszawa; Gdańsk; Gdynia; Łódź.Who You AreCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.To succeed in this role, we believe that you: Have experience in frontend development (preferred at least 4 years of experience as a developer)Demonstrate high level of software development skills
Your experience and background:  Experience with: Angular, Angular.js, JavaScript, Git, Maven, JenkinsKnowledge and good understanding of: Oracle DB / SQL, IntelliJ, SplunkKnowledge of SOLID principles Experience in test automation and performance/unit/integration testingNice to have knowledge of Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, Cypress and CucumberFluency in English
If this sounds like you, get in touch!Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 23/03/2023.At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: privacy-policy.2021.pdf (nordea.com)We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

Skills Required: Communication Protocols, Distributed Systems, Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP), Linux, Linux Kernel, Load Balancing, Problem Solving, Software Development, Transport Layer Security (TLS), Writing
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
Zendesk is looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer (Operations) to join our Edge engineering team. With existing Edge teams based in North America and EMEA, we are now growing our fully-remote EMEA team.Zendesk’s Edge services are the bridge between the public internet and Zendesk’s infrastructure. Zendesk's product suite will only be as reliable as our Edge services, and our challenge is to provide rock-solid services that our customers can rely upon and build on.We build massively scalable microservices that are on the critical path for every request that hits Zendesk, provides impactful automation tools for all Zendesk engineers to interact with these services and maintains the internal and external (customer facing) infrastructure that supports Zendesk’s most critical products.Your role will be to maintain and increase the reliability of this infrastructure, build services that will simplify and automate configuration and build traffic management solutions to improve the availability of Zendesk's products. Ship code to production and improve the experience of millions of Zendesk users.Use an outstanding modern technology stack: AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, Golang, etcWork collaboratively with a niche team of expert engineers.Use DevOps and SRE reliability practices: we build it, we run it!
What you bring to the role Consistent track record (more than two years) as a production/operations/SRE engineer working on high-traffic, customer-facing distributed systems, or in a similar engineering role.Deep understanding of network protocols, DNS, HTTP, TLS/SSL, load balancing.Experience in support of distributed systems, with Linux internals and administration knowledge.Knowledge of caching solutions, CDN (Cloudflare, Akamai, CloudFront, Fastly, etc.)2+ years using Python/Golang or a similar programming language to automate operational tasks, crafting operational reports, reducing team toil etcInterpersonal skills: you practice active listening.
 Experience working with container-based architectures: Docker, Kubernetes.Have a passion for identifying problems and fixing them. You run towards the fires!Have previous success working remotely. You are effective when working autonomously and collaborating asynchronously.A mature and pragmatic approach when choosing technologies.Strong writing skills. You understand the need to document first in a remote, async work environment.Experience, or willingness to learn, writing code in Golang.
Tech stack AWS, NGINX, CloudflareIaC: CloudFormation, Terraform, ChefK8s, DockerGolang, Ruby, PythonSpinnaker, Github, Datadog
Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love. We advocate for digital first customer experiences — and we stick with it in our workplace. Over 6,000 employees worldwide have the flexibility and trust to choose where they work. The fact is, we know great work happens anywhere. Whether you’re collaborating from your home office, a Zendesk workspace, or the kitchen table, you’re part of one team at Zendesk.Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

About the job
        

 
Would you like to check that all software work products are delivered with the required quality, cost and deadline so that all project milestones are met?Would you like to follow Nippon Seiki’s software and systems development process (ASPICE compliant)?Apply!Your profile University degree in engineering, preferably software engineering, electrical engineering, automotive engineering or an equivalent qualificationExperience in embedded software development with CMin. 1-2 years of work experience in embedded or automotive embedded industry environmentAffinity with communication buses like CAN, UART, SPI and related development tools is a plusGood command of the English language, both written and spoken
Key responsibilities Responsible for Inspection, Assessment, Program Production MeetingsEstimating new projects (including RFIs/RFQs) in term of effort, resources, cost, development planCreating Development Plans and SchedulesExecuting, Monitoring and Controlling the Development PlansTraining Employees in Processes and TechnologiesTechnical leading team of SW DevelopersCoordinating for self and team the adherence to the Software and Systems Development ProcessProcessing Requirements into Software (review, analysis, design and development)Creating and presenting SW ArchitectureEmbedded SW Development (development and integration of software on various controllers)Troubleshooting and modification of existing source code (including 3rd party systems integration)Coordinating Unit Tests and SW Components Tests creation and executionCoordinating, creating and executing Software Integration TestsCreating the Software Release work productsManaging Change Management Process (effort, resource, release plan)Managing the SW ConfigurationDetailed Error Analysis, if necessary at the customer siteTechnical support for customer meetingsCoaching and Mentoring of local and remote development teamsPreparation and presentation of technical reports, e.g. Error Status, Development Status and Release Status etc.Managing Suppliers
Our Offer A competitive salaryA pleasant working environment with strong focus on flexibility and work-life balanceWorking with state-of-the-art technologies on development of premium brand carsA chance to boost up your career in a multi-national companyParticipation in a benefits program consisting of premium health insurance package, sports card, multi-benefit cafeteria system, life and accident insurance, English classesBonus programs i.e. vacation payment, yearly bonus, employee awardsAdditional vacation daysRelocation packageFlexible working hoursTrainings opportunity
Join usFeeling excited to become a part of our team?Please send your CV in English via Apply Button or send to jobs@nippon-seiki.eu.com / hr.pl@nippon-seiki.eu.com.We would like to request that you include the following clause in your CV when applying for any suitable position. Including the clause is a prerequisite for further administering of your personal data in the recruitment process:“I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my application to be processed by Nippon Seiki (Europe) B.V., for the purposes of the recruitment process under the European Parliament’s and Council of the European Union Regulation on the Protection of Natural Persons as of 27 April 2016, with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (Data Protection Directive). I also give consent for my personal data to be processed for the purpose of future recruitment processes at Nippon Seiki (Europe) B.V..”Please be informed that we would only contact the selected candidates.

Skills Required: Front-End Development, HTML, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Server Side, TypeScript, User Interface Design, Version Control, Web Applications, Web Development, Web Performance
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
                  Our mission is great open source

It is our mission to make open source software available to people everywhere. We create world-renowned software, impacting the lives of millions of people every day.

The web team works in a multi-disciplinary environment with visual designers, UX designers and other developers to bring exciting new web projects to life. We help and learn from each other and constantly strive to improve both our work and our processes.

Required Skills And Experience
Demonstrable experience of work on modern web applicationsA strong understanding of HTML, CSS with SCSS and JavaScriptExperience with Javascript components librariesExperience with TypeScriptExperience with responsive user interfaces for a wide range of devices and browsersExperience with Git or other version control systemsAwareness of SEO best practiceConsideration of accessibility in all aspects of your workA strong understanding of web performance in complex user interfacesAbility to interact with UX, designers and server-side developersCuriosity about technology and a thirst to learnBased in EMEA timezones (Europe, the Middle East and Africa)University degree or equivalent education

Useful experience if you have it
Familiarity with Linux desktop technologiesServer-side languages, such as Python or NodeJSExperience working on a large scale React (with TypeScript) projectA history of open source contributionsRelevant work experience

Who you are

We want a Web Developer who loves what they do. You are passionate about web standards and keep abreast of new developments in our industry. You always look for opportunities to improve your skills. You like to show off what you're working on and also learn from others. You have strong attention to detail and value the design of a product as much as you value the code. You have strong communication skills and maybe even blog once in a while. You're aware of the latest CSS techniques but also know the limitations that developing for a broad audience can bring - actually, you embrace the challenge.

In this team
You'll create high fidelity websites and web apps using the latest incarnations of HTML, CSS (SCSS) and Javascript (React and TypeScript)You'll help maintain existing projects including updating content and adding new pagesYou'll manage incoming requests for updates and liaise with or delegate to other people as necessaryYou'll ensure the standard of our output remains high and consistent across our whole product portfolioYou'll ensure new pages are published according to specification and in compliance with our web style guideYou'll participate in and contribute to our living style guide, Vanilla Framework. Work closely with UX designers and visual designers to implement exemplary user experiences. 

What we offer
An opportunity to help shape a company and products with a strong influence in the open source communityAn inclusive work environment within a team of friendly people with a broad range of skill sets, from UX designers to copywritersLearning and developmentAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual leavePriority Pass for travel

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

Skills Required: Atlassian Bamboo, Atlassian Suite, Bitbucket, Communication, Confluence, High-Level Design, Jira, Level Design, PostgreSQL, Presentations
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
The number of people using the Atlassian suite of tools in Dyson is growing steadily, with over 2000 active users across our development centres in UK, Poland, Malaysia, Singapore & Philippines. The use of Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket & Bamboo within the Atlassian toolchain is continually expanding to support our scaled agile development model across all or teams in Research, Design & Development.The Atlassian specialist is a Software Tools Developer role required to define and develop new solutions within the context of the product development & business processes as well as drive continuous improvement within existing processes and solutions. Responsible for the day to day configuration and support of our Atlassian suite of tools, including optimising Jira workflows, Project templates and Build plans. You will also have to opportunity to work on our other development tools like Artifactory, BlackDuck & Sonarqube etc…The successful applicant will work to deliver world class technical solutions to issues & problems, improvements & enhancements, as well as delivering additional capabilities and applications to support the use of the Atlassian tools and applications within Dyson.You will report to the Tools & Process manager, working closely with other members of the immediate team as well as other areas of the research department, IT, training and optimisation teams in the business. You will help to deliver world class technical solutions within a global team that supports the SW organisation across multiple sites in UK, Poland & SEA.Taking a proactive approach in the generation of ideas; present ideas and concepts to senior management & help make informed decisions by interpreting complex data to drive direction.You will participate in planning, definition, and high-level design of the solution and exploration of solution alternatives.Leading technical delivery of requirements into tested solutions to agreed standards using agreed delivery methods, teaching and guiding others where necessary; including Investigation, definition and management of Atlassian add-ons and integrations.Take an active role to ensure that all engineering problems are resolved thoroughly & validated through appropriate test methods.Day to day support to Software teams to investigate and resolve support & incident ticket requests
Qualifications & skills: At least 2 years of Atlassian experience using JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo & Bitbucket.It’s essential you’re a self-starter and able to drive early concepts through to productionExcellent verbal and written communication skills and confident presenting your work and representing the team at all levels.You’ll be able to build consensus with stakeholders to ensure we deliver what our customers and the wider business needs.You’ll have a breadth of product & technical knowledge to support an integrated delivery approachAble to communicate and report on complex technical issues at all levels
 Clear focus and drive for delivery – you’ll be able to find and maintain focus and priority in a rapidly evolving environment.Curious, inventive and creative - be prepared to solve tough problems and look beyond convention.Effective communicator - concise and timely communication, managing facts and emotionGlobal collaborator & mentor - open minded to ideas from other perspectives and helping others in the teamResilient - prepared to be challenged and thrive in change
 A passion for software development and the tools and services needed to enable thatAn appreciation of using Agile techniques in large teams (Less, SAFe etc.)Knowledge of Sonarqube, Artifactory, BlackDuck, Google Test, CeedlingWorking knowledge of MS SQL / PostgreSQL databases, Open Source Configuration, Python/Bash scripting, Version Control - Git/SVN WorkingExperience of Linux operating systems; including Ubuntu / Red Hat / CentOSAn interest in extracting data and answers with tools like; Elastic Search, Grafana, Splunk, Tableau, SQL Python scripts etc.
Financial: Performance related bonus Life Assurance Accidental Death and Dismemberment InsurancePension scheme with competitive employer contributionsRecognition ProgramHoliday Allowance
 Free fruit delivered for office staff, free coffee and teaCafeteria Benefit – wellness programme/ cinema tickets/ Multisport card
 Medical careEmployee Assistance Program for employee and dependents
Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

Skills Required: Android, Automotive SPICE (ASPICE), Embedded Software, Embedded Systems, Hypervisor, Presales, Software Architecture, Software Development, System Development, System on a Chip (SoC)
Job Description:
About the job
        

 
Project Overview:In cooperation with the Customer, Intellias will develop on the bench and on the vehicle the future Infotainment embedded architecture in order to integrate and validate the future connected Customer innovations.The current project phase is aimed at identifying and implementing hardware resources HPC SOC, RTCU (Radio and Telematic Control Unit) ECU, audio architecture.Intellias is looking for experienced Software Architect who can bring his experience, intelligence, and inspiration to our team.The Software Architect should have a highly developed set of analytical, communication skills, and consulting capabilities. Also, ability to present and communicate complex technical solutions both to the client and team members. He or she should be able to identify technical risks, propose solutions and effectively communicate them to all stakeholders.Responsibilities: Play the key technical role in the project on a Software Level;Lead technical workshops with the Customer;Lead discovery analysis;Create Software Level artifacts according to ASPICE. 
Requirements: 7+ years in Automotive Embedded Software Development;3+ years in Automotive Software Architecture (ASPICE complient);Experience with IVI system development, RTCU, and Audio domain;Proficient experience with Polarion and Enterprise Architect tolls;Experience with Qualcomm SoC (SA 8195P);Fluent in C/C++;Excellent knowledge of Amazon OS/Android OS (Tiramisu);Fluent English;Excellent communication skills. 
Nice to have: Experience in pre-sales activities;Experience with Renesas and Infineon SoCs;Experience with Hypervisor solutions. 
Higher Education: Master's Degree.
